snippet: Newly arrived children who illegally crossed the border with Mexico on their own are flooding community groups and shelters seeking help.
abstract: Newly arrived children from Central America who illegally crossed the border with Mexico on their own are flooding New York community groups and shelters, even though the government's focus has been on the Southwest; they are seeking help in fighting deportation orders, getting health care, dealing with psychological traumas of migration, managing challenges of family reunification and enrolling in school.
lead_paragraph: Newly arrived children who illegally crossed the border with Mexico on their own are flooding community groups and shelters seeking help.

headline.main: Surge in Child Migrants Reaches New York, Overwhelming Advocates
headline.print_headline: New York Strains to Handle Surge in Child Migrants
